item.title: 英国石油公司投资阿根廷生产绿色航空燃料
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，由英国石油巨头英国石油公司（BP Plc）持股一半的泛美能源集团（Pan American Energy Group）正在酝酿一项投资，在其位于布宜诺斯艾利斯郊外的炼油厂生产清洁航空燃料。【原文：The Pan American Energy Group, half-owned by British oil major BP Plc, is mulling an investment to make clean jet fuel at its refinery outside Buenos Aires, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大风加剧火灾威胁，加州面临断电风险
item.description: 由于温暖干燥的大风席卷整个地区，有可能摧毁公用设施线路并引发野火，因此从周二开始，加利福尼亚沿海地区的居民可能面临停电。【原文：Residents of coastal California are facing potential power shutoffs starting Tuesday as warm, dry winds sweep across the region, threatening to tear down utility lines and spark wildfires.】

item.title: 即使政治挑战日益严峻，法国仍坚持气候目标
item.description: 法国新政府重申了其减少碳排放和推广清洁能源的计划，尽管在夏季大选之后，新政府面临着更大的财政限制和政治挑战。【原文：France’s new government reaffirmed its plan to reduce carbon emissions and promote clean energy, even as it faced greater fiscal constraints and political challenges after the summer’s snap elections.】

item.title: 特鲁多将命令石油和天然气生产商减排 35
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）的政府将要求加拿大的石油和天然气行业在 2019 年的基础上减排 35%，这一政策势必会激化与该国西部省份的紧张关系。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government will require Canada’s oil and gas industry to cut emissions by 35% from 2019 levels, a policy that is set to inflame tensions with the country’s western provinces.】

item.title: 拉斐尔风暴可能威胁墨西哥湾的石油和天然气生产：天气观察
item.description:
今天，大西洋飓风季节的第17场风暴出现在彭博社-格林的雷达上。【原文：

item.title: 芬兰首次在西海岸附近海域记录到飓风
item.description: 随着欧洲遭遇更多极端天气，芬兰沿海水域首次遭遇飓风袭击。【原文：Finland’s coastal waters were hit by hurricane-force winds for the first time, as more extreme weather batters Europe.】

item.title: 西班牙致命风暴北上加泰罗尼亚引发混乱
item.description: 巴塞罗那的交通系统陷入瘫痪，加泰罗尼亚是西班牙遭受特大风暴袭击的最新一个地区，上周在邻近的瓦伦西亚，特大风暴造成 200 多人死亡。【原文：Barcelona’s transport system ground to a halt, as Catalonia was the latest Spanish region to be hit by extreme storms that killed more than 200 people in neighboring Valencia last week.】

item.title: 极端降雨越来越频繁，也越来越致命
item.description: 近几个月来，暴雨引发的洪水和山体滑坡已在非洲、欧洲、亚洲和美国部分地区造成数百人死亡，数百万人流离失所。【原文：Torrential rains that triggered floods and landslides have killed hundreds of people and displaced millions across parts of Africa, Europe, Asia and the US in recent months.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气价格在无风天气中跟随石油走高
item.description: 欧洲大陆和英国的天然气价格追随原油涨势走高，而该地区的无风天气也促进了对燃料的需求。【原文：Natural gas prices in mainland Europe and the UK moved higher, tracking gains in crude, while windless weather across the region bolsters demand for the fuel.】

item.title: 经纪人马什提供针对假碳信用额的保险
item.description: 在碳信用额工具屡屡成为 "洗绿 "指控的对象之后，保险经纪人 Marsh 将开始提供合同，以保护公司免受碳信用额市场欺诈行为的侵害。【原文：Insurance broker Marsh will start offering contracts to protect companies against fraud in the market for carbon credits, after the instruments became the subject of recurring allegations of greenwashing.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚火山爆发造成 9 人死亡，房屋被烧毁
item.description: 印度尼西亚毛梅雷（美联社）— 印度尼西亚国家灾害管理局周一表示，随着偏远的弗洛勒斯岛火山爆发范围的扩大，至少已有六人死亡。【原文：MAUMERE, Indonesia (AP) — Indonesia’s National Disaster Management Agency said Monday that at least six people have died as a series of volcanic eruptions widens on the remote island of Flores.】

item.title: 印度将改进电力需求预测以改善规划
item.description: 印度正在全面改革预测电力需求的方式，以确保发电能力与需求相匹配，并确保电网在清洁能源不断增加的情况下保持稳定。【原文：India is overhauling the way it forecasts electricity demand to ensure generation capacity matches what’s needed and the grid remains stable with increasing volumes of clean energy.】

item.title: 矿业利润下滑，中国顶级煤炭企业向电力领域倾斜
item.description: 随着燃料价格下降和电气化在中国低碳转型中占据中心位置，中国的顶级煤炭生产商正加速向发电领域进军。【原文：China’s top coal producers are accelerating a move into power generation as fuel prices drop and electrification takes center stage in China’s low-carbon transition.】

item.title: 世界承诺控制甲烷。甲烷排放量仍在上升
item.description:
约有 160 个国家和 140 家公司承诺应对这种强效温室气体，但化石燃料行业的排放量仍接近历史最高水平。【原文：

About 160 countries and 140 companies pledged to combat the potent greenhouse gas, yet releases from the fossil fuels sector remain near record highs. 

】

item.title: 自科维德事件以来，致命真菌疫情在全球范围内呈上升趋势
item.description: 在 "Covid-19 "大流行和地球变暖的帮助下，一种罕见但致命的真菌正在世界各地加速繁殖，而地球变暖似乎正在训练它们在越来越高的温度下生存。【原文：A largely unnoticed surge of rare but deadly fungi is accelerating around the world, helped by the Covid-19 pandemic and a warming planet that appears to be training them to survive at higher and higher temperatures.】

item.title: 气候旅游投资者正在散去：绿色日报
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注气候技术融资的明显下降趋势，因为就在该行业需要更多资金起步之际，普通风险投资公司正在撤离。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the stark downward trend in climate tech funding as generalist VCs are moving away right as the industry needs more capital to get off the ground. item.title: 联合国自然峰会因各国就资金问题争论不休而无疾而终
item.description:
在会谈进入超时后，哥伦比亚暂停了COP16会议。但各国在分享企业从自然界获得的收益和为土著人民建立一个新机构方面取得了进展。【原文：

Colombia suspended COP16 after talks went into overtime. But countries notched progress on sharing corporate proceeds derived from nature and creating a new body for Indigenous peoples. 

】

item.title: 全球自然融资协议在 COP16 加时会谈中受挫
item.description:
由于欧盟、瑞士和其他发达国家反对建立新的生物多样性基金，谈判在最后一刻破裂。【原文：

Negotiations fell apart at the 11th hour when the EU, Switzerland and other developed countries objected to the creation of a new biodiversity fund. 

】

item.title: 气候怀疑论者正在为特朗普第二任期策划大计划
item.description:
激进分子将推动共和党新政府提高燃煤发电量、阻止美国环保署的科学研究并挑战全球变暖模型。【原文：

Activists would push a new Republican administration to boost coal-fired power, block EPA science and challenge models of global warming.

】

item.title: 西班牙首相称洪灾应对不力将增派军队
item.description: 西班牙政府下令向巴伦西亚洪灾地区部署和平时期最大规模的军队和安全部队，以应对该国数十年来最大的自然灾害。【原文：Spain’s government ordered its biggest peace-time deployment of military and security forces to the flood-hit region of Valencia as the country grapples with the largest natural disaster in decades.】

item.title: 西班牙努力应对造成数百人死亡的洪灾
item.description: 山洪暴发三天后，瓦伦西亚省东部的一个小镇乌蒂尔（Utiel）被洪水席卷，志愿者们在废墟中跋涉，帮助清理破碎的家具，铲走泥土。【原文：Three days after flash floods swept through Utiel, a tiny town in the eastern province of Valencia, volunteers trudged through debris to help clear broken furniture and shovel away mud.】

item.title: 就在欧佩克考虑增加供应之际，大型石油公司调高了产量增速
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.）和雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp. capped Big Oil earnings season by revealing blockbuster increases in fossil fuel production — just as OPEC and its allies are preparing to increase the supply of crude into the global market.】

item.title: 清理原始海滩意味着从太空中发现塑料垃圾
item.description:
正在对卫星探测进行测试，以帮助解决进入海洋和沿海生态系统的数百万吨废物问题。【原文：

Satellite detections are being tested to help tackle the millions of tons of waste that enter marine and coastal ecosystems.

】

item.title: 特斯拉出售由太阳能设备贷款支持的 4.99 亿美元债务
item.description: 特斯拉公司出售了 4.99 亿美元的债券，这些债券由向购买太阳能设备的客户提供的贷款支持。【原文：Tesla Inc. sold $499 million of bonds backed by loans offered to customers buying solar equipment.】

item.title: 加拿大油砂联盟征集碳捕集管道提案
item.description: 加拿大油砂生产商集团在建设一个价值 160 亿加元的碳捕集与封存网络方面迈出了第一步，该网络将有助于减少该行业的碳排放量。【原文：A group of Canadian oil sands producers took an initial step in constructing a C$16 billion carbon capture and storage network that would help slash the industries carbon emissions.】

item.title: 拜登将在大选后跳过 COP29 气候峰会
item.description: 乔-拜登总统将不会出席在美国大选后几天开幕的联合国气候变化峰会，这次峰会将决定美国未来几年在气候变化问题上的态度。【原文：President Joe Biden will not attend a major UN climate change summit opening just days after the US election and set to shape the country’s approach to the issue for years to come.】

item.title: 多米尼克公司与更多科技公司就下一代核能技术进行谈判
item.description: 多米尼昂能源公司正积极与包括技术公司在内的潜在合作伙伴商讨开发小型模块化核反应堆的协议；这与该公司上个月与亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.【原文：Dominion Energy Inc. is actively involved in discussions with potential partners, including technology firms, on agreements to develop small modular nuclear reactors — similar to the deal it signed with Amazon.com Inc. last month.】

item.title: 美国顶级电力监管机构将数据中心视为重要机遇
item.description: 联邦最高能源监管机构表示，支持数据中心的发展，包括提供其所需的大量电力，事关国家安全。【原文：Supporting the development of data centers — including providing the enormous amounts of electricity they require — is a matter of national security, a top federal energy regulator said.】

item.title: 南非汽车出口因欧盟更严格的排放规定而骤降
item.description: 南非的汽车出口量几乎减少了一半，部分原因是欧洲更严格的排放规定导致需求放缓，以及来自中国的廉价电动汽车的竞争。【原文：South African car exports almost halved, partly due to a slowdown in demand in Europe because of stricter emission rules and competition from cheaper electric vehicles from China.】
